config.question: What role did the Populist party play in strengthening the relationship between blacks and whites?

choices.content: In the South, some Populists worked to unite black and white farmers.
The People’s party was created by blacks but also included white members.
Populists continually organized protests to support black voting rights.
Blacks and whites in Kansas and North Dakota united to fight the People’s party.

answer_3.response: In the South, some Populists worked for a time to unite black and white farmers. They believed the blacks had problems similar to them.
